hackathon-description-text: TrojanHacks: Strikes Back is a beginner-friendly, 24-hour hackathon open to all USC students! Many students have never been to a hackathon and feel like they don't have enough experience or skills to contribute to their team. We want to change this mentality. USC ACM wants to show you that you can go from little to no experience to making something you're proud of - you just need to put your mind to it!
hackathon-rules: TrojanHacks: Strikes Back is a beginner-friendly, 24-hour hackathon open to all USC students! Many students have never been to a hackathon and feel like they don't have enough experience or skills to contribute to their team. We want to change this mentality. USC ACM wants to show you that you can go from little to no experience to making something you're proud of - you just need to put your mind to it
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=5151 State University Dr, Los Angeles, CA 90032, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is this a product that people will use in their daily lives? Will it make lives better?
How difficult was it to implement this project? Are there multiple APIs, languages, and libraries involved? Did you use a really cool algorithm?
Is this project unique and innovative? Is it a solution to a problem we haven't seen before? A better way of doing something?
Is your hack polished? Create a streamlined hack that looks as good as it functions!

hackathon-location-address: 5151 State University Dr, Los Angeles, CA 90032, USA
hackathon-description-header: USC ACM's hackathon for new hackers. All are welcome!
